nociception_negative_sensor.principle: Pain detects ABSENCE of integrity, not presence

nociceptors.definition: Specialized nerve endings detecting harmful stimuli

c_fibers.function: Persistent reminder, promotes protective healing behavior

pain_pathway.peripheral: Nociceptor → dorsal root ganglion → spinal cord dorsal horn

acute.definition: Sudden onset, clear cause, protective function
acute.function: Warning of immediate damage, promotes protective behavior
acute.examples: Cut, burn, fracture, surgical pain, childbirth

chronic.definition: Persistent beyond normal healing time (>3-6 months)
chronic.causes: Nerve damage, persistent inflammation, central sensitization, unknown
chronic.dysfunction: Pain system itself damaged (pain without ongoing tissue damage)
chronic.suffering: Severe impact on quality of life, major disability
chronic.examples: Neuropathy, fibromyalgia, phantom limb, chronic back pain

nociceptive.somatic: Skin, muscle, bone (sharp, aching, throbbing, localized)
nociceptive.visceral: Internal organs (deep, cramping, diffuse, poorly localized)

neuropathic.definition: From nervous system damage or dysfunction
neuropathic.examples: Diabetic neuropathy, post-herpetic neuralgia, nerve injury, MS pain

nociplastic.definition: Altered pain processing without clear damage or nerve pathology
nociplastic.examples: Fibromyalgia, some chronic low back pain, IBS
nociplastic.controversial: Mechanisms still being elucidated, diagnosis challenging

sensory_discriminative.information: Where hurts, how much, what kind (sharp, dull, burning)

affective_motivational.function: Creates urgency, motivates escape, promotes healing behavior
affective_motivational.separable: Can be reduced by meditation, hypnosis, prefrontal lobotomy while sensory component remains

cognitive_evaluative.modulation: Past experience, beliefs, culture affect pain profoundly
cognitive_evaluative.placebo: Expectation alone can significantly reduce pain (measurable brain changes)

gate_control.theory: Melzack & Wall (1965): Spinal 'gate' can open or close pain signals
gate_control.mechanism: Non-painful input (touch, vibration) can close gate to pain
gate_control.application: Rubbing injury reduces pain. TENS therapy.
gate_control.revolutionary: Changed pain understanding from simple stimulus-response to complex modulation

descending_control.source: Brain sends inhibitory signals down spinal cord
descending_control.periaqueductal_gray: PAG = key structure for pain inhibition

attention.distraction: Directing attention away from pain reduces perception significantly
attention.meditation: Mindfulness reduces suffering component while sensory component remains
attention.catastrophizing: Ruminating on pain amplifies experience dramatically

expectation.placebo: Belief treatment will help → real pain reduction (brain opioid release)
expectation.nocebo: Expectation of pain → increased pain experience
expectation.powerful: Expectation = major pain modulator (30-50% placebo response rates)

survival_value.warning: Immediate signal of danger to body integrity
survival_value.learning: Avoid harmful situations in future (burn → avoid fire)
survival_value.protection: Favors injured area (limp protects broken leg during healing)
survival_value.urgency: Creates motivation to escape threat or seek help

congenital_insensitivity.cipa: Congenital insensitivity to pain with anhidrosis (genetic mutation)

congenital_insensitivity.proof: Pain essential for survival despite suffering it causes
congenital_insensitivity.life_expectancy: Typically don't survive to adulthood without extreme vigilance

evolutionary_tradeoff.chronic_malfunction: When pain system breaks, cost without benefit

healing_stages.inflammation: Initial response: redness, swelling, heat, pain (days)
